basic.description:
This course will investigate how the new Europe and film shaped each other. European film is our starting point for investigating the connections between work and art. Topics will include: urban space; (post- and para-); socialist societies; border crossings, especially gendered labour and cultural flows.
NOTE    Taught in English together with LLCU 326/3.0. Students in a German Plan will submit written assignments, tests and examinations in German. Normally, they will read German texts in the original.
basic.subject: GRMN
basic.title: Film in the New Europe

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite    A grade of C in GRMN202 or permission of the Dept. of Languages, Literatures and Cultures.
Exclusion    No more than 3.0 units from INTS326; GRMN426; LLCU326
